urls.title: BBC Director General Tim Davie’s speech and Q&A on leading the UK into Digital
urls.description: Listen to this episode from The RTS Podcast on Spotify. On the 7th December, the BBC’s Director General, Tim Davie, gave a speech to the RTS about the future of the media industry and the role of public service broadcasters, particularly the BBC, within that. Speaking 100 years and 27 days since the BBC’s first ever broadcast, Davie set out his stall for an internet-only BBC, arguing that the broadcaster could become a world-leading pioneer as the first digitally led public service media company of scale.  After his speech, Davie sat down with Theresa Wise, Chief Executive of the Royal Television Society for a Q&A session, in which he discussed what he thinks an internet-only BBC could look like.

data.text: Listen to the BBC’s Director General, Tim Davie, give a speech to the RTS about the future of the media industry and the role of public service broadcasters on The RTS Podcast https://t.co/x6PFCwdqwN https://t.co/TTMJBDUAnX

urls.title: RTS Craft & Design Awards 2022
urls.description: The nominations for the RTS Craft & Design Awards 2022, sponsored by Apple TV+, have been announced.

data.text: Congratulations to all of the winners from tonight's RTS Craft & Design Awards 2022, sponsored by @AppleTVPlus! Check out the full list of winners, including shows @ThePeakyBlinder, #Heartstopper, This is Going to Hurt and Derry Girls https://t.co/xQ9vE7n0vT #RTSAwards https://t.co/0dzYwsBlp6

Claire Popplewell & the @bbcstudios Events Team win the Outstanding Contribution Award for harnessing “the great power of live television to bring people together to witness some of the most important events in history” including Live 8 and Queen Elizabeth II’s funeral #RTSAwards https://t.co/XFj1zTYsGo

The RTS Special Award goes to Surian Fletcher-Jones, who “has built a slate of critically acclaimed TV series that have broken new ground, championed diverse voices, created meaningful impact on global audiences and have been celebrated by the industry” #RTSAwards https://t.co/Nnjrqk9qXQ

The Editing – Entertainment and Comedy goes to Paul Dingwall for @bbcthree’s Cheaters, which “succeeded in making the jury laugh through pacy, whip-smart editing and a willingness to mesh funny and shocking moments together” #RTSAwards https://t.co/ldeKP0oEw1

Erik Wilson BSC wins the Photography – Drama & Comedy award for his “unusual and experimental” style in Landscapers which was “a brilliantly executed piece” that showed “inventiveness through and through” #RTSAwards https://t.co/tt4rDNZdJr

.@andrew_chaplin wins the Director – Comedy Drama/Situation Comedy award for Alma's Not Normal. The jury admired the way the winner honed “a very funny comedy with stellar performances, without smoothing over the raw edges of the material” #RTSAwards https://t.co/1D0ugO52Sc

The Editing – Drama award goes to Lucien Clayton for the “masterful editing technique from start to finish” and a “seamless and epic final episode” for Derry Girls Series 3 #RTSAwards https://t.co/Z075cNefnE

This is Going to Hurt wins again for Sound – Drama! The jury praised Nina Rice, Steve Browell, Jamie Selway & Adam Horley’s “very realistic mix” which the panel all agreed “made you think you were there” – well done to the team #RTSAwards https://t.co/nWBLSRCBrn

Congratulations to the Director – Drama award winner Lucy Forbes (@forbesforbes) for This is Going to Hurt. The jury praised the director’s “visually distinctive, urgent, truthful, brilliantly crafted direction with outstanding performances” #RTSAwards https://t.co/xprWwGFjw3

Lin Davie, Sue Newbould & Laura Flynn take home the Make Up Design – Drama award for Gentleman Jack 2, which judges described as “spot on every time, never over the top – beautiful, without being over styled or theatrical” #RTSAwards https://t.co/aoyKx6bR6o

The next award goes to Alison McCosh for Costume Design – Drama for Peaky Blinders Series 6. Judges said the “strong identity perfectly balancing the sumptuous and the believable – it has the wow factor” #RTSAwards @ThePeakyBlinder https://t.co/dGq43V2LKl

“Clever, sophisticated, visually arresting, incredible attention to detail and briliantly inventive Production Design” – the next award goes to Landscapers’ @ccasali, Robert Wischhusen-Hayes & Fabrice Spelta for Production Design – Drama #RTSAwards https://t.co/gOBrrHg5MF

Well done to the Casting Award winner @dedwardscasting, who “showcased fresh, vital and exciting casting” for @NetflixUK’s Heartstopper which was “an authentic portrayal of young modern life” #RTSAwards https://t.co/1rjefzJzFg

Our first ever Production Management Award goes to Laura Djanogly, Jen Bollom & Mei Ye Li for Concert For Ukraine. Judges were in awe of the “small but impressive team” and their “amazing team effort for this unique event which raised £13.4m” #RTSAwards https://t.co/QUgAuGu0V3

Julia Knowles takes home the second award for @bbcstudios’ Platinum Party at the Palace for Director – Multicamera for the “ground breaking and truly memorable” event. Congratulations! #RTSAwards https://t.co/TEatwsaULp
The next award goes to Nigel Catmur (@ncatmur) for the “epic but beautifully detailed” Lighting for Multicamera for @bbcstudios’ Platinum Party at the Palace #RTSAwards https://t.co/mSIDw0eR3m

Well done to Chris Power and the Camera Team for their Multicamera Work on Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, which judges described as a “stunning format with incredibly complex coverage - brilliantly executed” #RTSAwards @McInTweet https://t.co/Dhhg4H25Hy

Nicholas Perry & Philip Hughes win the Editing – Sport award for the Commonwealth Games Opening Ceremony Opener - Our Birmingham: A Brummie Story. Jurors felt that the film “really captured the essence and emotion of an event that was about more than just sport” #RTSAwards https://t.co/OU1btwr0L7

The award for Photography - Documentary/Factual & Non Drama goes to Tim Shepherd, Todd Kewley, Oliver Mueller & Camera Team for The Green Planet. The judges praised the “innovative, clever and technically impressive work” - well done to the team! #RTSAwards https://t.co/1MbXf9bqSG

“A beautifully crafted piece of music, delicately balancing tension with a very prominent and distinctive melody” – the award for Music – Original Title goes to @carlyparadis for @SkyStudios’ The Rising #RTSAwards https://t.co/QmWdR3tXEI

Congratulations to Nicôle Lecky & @BryanSenti who take home the award Music – Original Score for MOOD, which judges praised for “its authenticity and clear demonstration of original ideas - as well as brilliant execution” #RTSAwards https://t.co/HTSjCVGeRE

Bruce Law, David Pearson & Bumble Bee Post Team win the Editing – Documentary/Factual award for 9/11: Life Under Attack. The judges were impressed with “the meticulous crafting of huge volumes of footage into such a moving and impactful piece” #RTSAwards https://t.co/f01T42ut96

“A confident director determined to get their material against almost impossible odds” and “documentary making at its most urgent & most necessary” - @sfcollinson wins the Director – Documentary/Factual & Non Drama award for Fearless: The Women Fighting Putin #RTSAwards https://t.co/bh9srsqexj

The Effects award goes to @VineFX & @realsfx for the “consistently high quality” and “breadth and variety of VFX craftmanship” for @skytv’s The Lazarus Project – congratulations to the team! #RTSAwards https://t.co/taPQVLFmUh

.@madeincolour takes home the Design – Programme Content Sequences award for @BBCNewsround’s Empire & Me: A Newsround Special. The jury felt this was “a difficult topic that was executed impeccably for a children’s audience” #RTSAwards https://t.co/08ViU2rwhe

Well done to the team at @yuandcompany for the Design – Titles award win for an “incredibly well thought out, designed and animated title sequence” for The Essex Serpent #RTSAwards https://t.co/HZreyOvdDZ

Congratulations to @ThomasUrbye who takes home the Picture Enhancement award for @skytv’s Landscapers. The judges praised the “traditional analogue quality of the submission and the transitions between sequences” #RTSAwards https://t.co/PWEJsWiTdd

The Sound – Entertainment & Non Drama award goes to @nickfrymix, James Spooner & @jamesjonesfilm for the “captivating sound design, which created an engaging authentic environment” on Chernobyl: The Lost Tapes #RTSAwards https://t.co/niLGShaF5d
Catherine Land wins the Production Design – Entertainment & Non Drama award for the “uplifting and vibrant Production Design” on @antanddec’s @itvtakeaway Series 18 #RTSAwards https://t.co/6GmpzfA9A5

.@lisaAmakeup & Lisa Davey take home the Make Up Design – Entertainment & Non Drama award for their “astonishing, phenomenal and amazing” work on Strictly Come Dancing Series 19 #RTSAwards @bbcstrictly https://t.co/EtV2JUmzNz

The first award of the night goes to @Plunge_UK & Bandicoot Scotland for “exemplary” Costume Design – Entertainment & Non Drama for @MaskedSingerUK Series 3, which judges described as “a visual treat that is all about costume” #RTSAwards https://t.co/fG1hqLRgEO

urls.title: Ben Willbond, Laurence Rickard and Lolly Adefope | We Are Not Alone Q&A
urls.description: Listen to this episode from The RTS Podcast on Spotify. Two of the Horrible Histories troupe, Laurence Rickard and Ben Willbond, joined us with UKTV on Tuesday 15 November at Curzon Hoxton to talk all things alien, human and their new Dave comedy, We Are Not Alone. And chairing the chat was none other than their fellow Ghosts star Lolly Adefope!

data.text:
Do you believe in aliens? What would they find most confusing about humankind?

@Lazbotron and @benwillbond answered this and more at the screening and Q&A for their new comedy #WeAreNotAlone. Listen back here: https://t.co/bshsNjdol2 https://t.co/ioMDwulKxT
